title: Creates the natural disaster reinsurance fund
summary: Creates the natural disaster reinsurance fund financed through voluntary participation by insurers in the state to provide additional protection in the case of catastrophic events; exempts any amounts deposited into the fund from taxation by the state, county, municipality or local taxing authority; prohibits participating insurers from increasing any premiums based upon payments to such fund.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2582

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the insurance law, in relation to creating a state natural
disaster reinsurance fund

SUMMARY:
This bill amends the insurance law by adding a new article 80.
The purpose of this bill found in Section 8001 is to create a natural
disaster reinsurance fund to be financed through voluntary
participation of insurers. The fund will provide subscribing
companies with a pool of available funds to be accessed when a
catastrophic event raises claims above a given level and will thus
reduce the potential for insurance company insolvencies due to
natural disasters and other catastrophic events. Section 8002 of this
bill provides definitions of "natural disaster" or "catastrophic
event" as well as the definition of "fund" pursuant to this article.
Section 8003 states that the superintendent will have custody of the
natural disaster reinsurance fund.

Also, when necessary the state shall establish and adjust the rates
for the reinsurance coverage using generally accepted actuarial
principles.
The state will hold these funds in trust and shall allow them to be
absolved only when participating insurers make claims against the fund.
Section 8004 provides that participating insurers are eligible to make
claims against the fund when a natural disaster, or a series of
natural disasters, occurs which results in claims exceeding 15% of
the industry's surplus. Section 8005 exempts any amounts deposited
into the fund account from taxation by the state or by any county,
municipality or local taxing authority. Section 8006 of this bill
prohibits participating insurers from increasing any premiums based
upon payments made to the fund.

JUSTIFICATION:
This legislation would create a fund
which insurance
companies can tap into in the case of a natural disaster or
catastrophic event. Currently, in the instance of a catastrophic
event, insurers must bear the expenses incurred upon them by their
clients. This bill would prevent insurance company insolvencies
should their claims rise above a given level due to natural disasters
or catastrophic events.
This bill is a preventative measure we must make in case of future
crisis in this state. This bill provides protection for consumers
from insurance companies raising premiums to cover abundant claims in
the event of a natural disaster.

FISCAL IMPLICATION:
To be determined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect January 1, 2012, provided
however, that the
superintendent of insurance shall promulgate any rules
and regulations necessary for the timely implementation of this act on
or before its effective date.
